title: Greenbelt Park: National Trails Day
body: Explore This Park    Get Involved     Volunteer     National Trails Day              National Trails Day        Thank you National Trails Day Volunteers !!         Thank you Volunteers for helping on National Trails Day. Your volunteer effort will allow visitors to enjoy the nine miles of trails.        National Trails Day insignia American Hiking Society        Volunteers, Please register via Event Brite for the National Trails Day project. Registration is mandatory      Join us at Greenbelt Park for a day to celebrate trails. The park does not have an entrance fee so you can enjoy a hike on one of four trails throughout the day. We begin the day with a trail maintenance project at 9:00 a.m. (register by using Event Brite link) Invasive Plant removal begins at 11:00 a.m. Outdoor Ethics and Leave No Trace talk will be presented at 12 noon.  A unique feature of National Trails Day at Greenbelt will be a Civil War program featuring musket firing demonstrations at 11:00 a.m. and 1:00 p.m.   All volunteers will meet at the Sweetgum Picnic Area  8:45 a.m. Registration and Information for Trail Projects 9:00 - 4:00 War Passed Here Civil War program 9:00 Trail projects 11:00 Invasive Plant Removal 11:00 Musket Firing Demonstration 12:00 Outdoor Ethics and Leave No Trace talk 1:00 Artillery Demonstration  June 4, 2016 is American Hiking Society’s National Trails Day®, the country’s largest celebration of trails.  National Trails Day events will take place in every state across the country and will include hikes, biking and horseback rides, paddling trips, birdwatching, geocaching, gear demonstrations, stewardship projects and more
